posts.title: Node.js
posts.body: I heard that it can help, but it looks like it has a lot of boilerplate!

comments.text: Async code can be easily written ‚Äùas sync‚Äù with async / await.

Based on your use case, you actually want to do an aggregation in your MongoDB. In mongoose, you do that with the model.aggregate()method which returns a AggregationCursor that lazily fetches documents in batches. Since AggregationCursor extends node's built-in ReadableStream, now you can work with it using all sorts of APIs, including for-await-of loops.
